comment: Class is set up so you can succeed even if you do poorly on exams which is nice because her tests are HARD. She asks obscure questions and uses other tricky methods to stump you. She's a caring professor, but get ready to struggle because genetics is hard and she makes it harder.

She is very good with genetics and a very forgiving grader. 5 total tests, 1 retake, 120/160 points of HW are counted, 6/12 quizzes are counted, and the final is noncumulative. Her lectures have all the information so I recommend class even if not mandatory. Once you learn her style for exams, her class is a breeze. Can't recommend her enough.

Dr Vogelien is a great professor! Material is hard no matter who you take, she makes it bearable she is enthusiastic about material and gives you everything you need to succeed on exam. Focus in class, all her test material is covered in class. Quizes weekly, but she only takes the best seven grades. Five-chapter exams, no final.

Very easy to talk to and always available for questions!  Make sure you pay attention and take notes!  She will also look over your notes as well and give tips on things you need to know and write down.  Some of the questions on the tests came straight from the textbook so make sure you read the assignments she gives.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Very sweet lady, but means business when it comes to exams. They are no joke! I loved her and got an A because I'm a huge bio nerd, but pretty much everyone else struggled. If you're not a bio nerd like me, do not take her! She is pretty much 100% lecture based and can go on tangents.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring--Tests are tough

comment: 4 exams each worth 100 points, grades online hw based only on completion (only need 90 of the 160 points for full credit), and 15 online quizzes that she takes your highest 7 grades of (each worth 5 points). So the entire semester is ONLY 525 points! 1 mess up and your grade is done. The bio department really needs to work on this. It's not fair!

I hate to say this, but KSU REALLY needs to hire other genetics professors. Don't get me wrong, Vogelein is an AMAZING teacher, but the 4 exams were pretty tough, and it's entirely lecture based. She'll use powerpoints in class and will ramble on each slide for like 20 minutes. Sweet lady, but HARD tests!

This class was really hard for me and the exams were as well. But I recommended taking her 100%. She will go above and beyond to make sure you understand the material. Take advantage of her office hours for sure! It helps a ton. She gives weekly quizzes and only counts 7 out of 15. There's the regular mastering hw  as well
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: This is a hard class, period. But Dr. Vogelien makes it a bit easier to understand because she knows how hard it is for undergrads. She's very nice and approachable and makes herself available for help. Only counts 1/2 the quizzes and HW, final replaces lowest exam grade. Just READ,  GO TO S.I., ask her anything else you're worried about.

She's so nice and helpful, really wants the students to excel. Tests are very detailed in the material. At least takes a few days to study that material for the exam. quizzes are difficult, probably harder than the exams sometimes.

Dr. Vogelien was a passionate lecturer, which made going to class much easier. Like others have said, she only counts half the quizzes you take, so it's an easy grade booster. Reading the textbook is necessary to do well. Be prepared to study, because her test questions can be pretty specific. Overall, very fair professor, would take again.

She is AMAZING! I wish I could take her again. Genetics is a hard class, but she is very clear in all her lectures and even does a review at the beginning of class to make sure everyone is on the same page. 1 or 2 quizzes weekly (she counts 9 out of 18) for easy grade boosters. Re write your notes while studying and do suggested HW.

Great professor, one of the best I have had at KSU, she makes the class interesting, she is very passionate about genetics, make sure you do well on quizzes (only 9 out of 18 count), her tests are pretty hard, but if you read the book and study for 2-3 nights in a row before the test you should be fine.

She really knows her stuff when it comes to Genetics. You can tell she enjoys teaching. She is always available during her office hours to help. Her exams are not the easiest . She gives a lot of quizzes but only grade the best 9.  You have to go to the lectures and read the books to understand the material.  This class requires a lot of time
This class is no fun but Dr Vogelien makes it okay. She is enthusiastic and intelligent. Studying for genetics took ALL of my free time. take very detailed notes and do the suggested problems.

She is a great professor, her quizzes are extremely easy and she gives you about 30 and only counts your highest 6 grades. However, they are nothing like her exams so dont rely on them. Her tests are extremely hard. Her questions are in MCAT format so be prepared to really analyze her questions.

Great professor. Her class is not easy, but she tries to be as clear as possible and tells you what's important for the test and what's not. It's obvious that she is very passionate about teaching and enjoys it very much. She's very helpful if you need it and will do everything she can to help you do well.

I love Dr. V. She is a great. I won't lie, it's a hard class and she is very thorough when she teaches. I took it over the summer, but she made sure we knew what was happening and she was amazing in lab. I have her again for BTEC 3301 and I still love her. I'd always recommend her. It is a lot of studying though, but that's just how Genetics is.

She is a nice lady, but it is really hard to get a hold of her. The class is hard and requires lots of study time, her tests are VERY detailed! The material is enjoyable and interesting, but you'll suffer seeing your grade drop. It's a torture! I started off loving the class and right about now I am praying it will be over soon!

Dr. V is the BEST teacher I've had since transferring to KSU. I would take her for any class she teaches if it's in my curriculum. She's understanding and fair, and tries to make sure you know the material as best as possible. STUDY HARD! She doesn't hand out grades & tries to make sure to give you as many chances as possible to make a good grade

Many thing plant physiology is hard.  It's not.  It is a lot of memorization.  You don't need the book because she is so thorough in class, but it is a good supplement. Even without an interest in plants this class is really interesting if you like pathways.  I really enjoyed myself.  In any sense, Dr. V is the reason you should take this class.
She is tricky. The concepts were not difficult but she made it became hard. Don't take her. I was interested in Genetics before I took her class but I guess I'm not interested in it any more.

Her exams and quizzes are extremely hard and very detailed. Unfortunately I found that her exams are more centered towards details than understanding the actual big picture concepts and how things work at the DNA/RNA level.

This is one of the best professors I've ever had.  She makes the problems very simple to understand.  Just go to every class and do the problems she assigns for an easy A.  You don't have to read the book that much, but, again, DO THE PROBLEMS ASSIGNED.

Despite previous high ratings on here. I didn't find her to be as great as I thought. Genetics isn't that hard but I lost my interests in it after I took her class.I felt she made it harder than it actually is. Well, if u take her class, you're not only need to study hard, but u have to study smart. Best of luck.

Awesome teacher!  She is so excited about teaching, she will get you involved.  Her class is hard, but you will know the material really well for all your other classes.  DO SUGGESTED HOMEWORK, go to class, and make use of her office hours, and you'll get an A.  Highly recommend Dr. V!!

Extremely helpful. She tried to adjust her office hour to accommodate the students. She is very articulate. She made the difficult topic easier for her students. However, her exam can be tricky and detail-oriented. If you study hard for it and do the home work question, she should be doing just fine. I strongly recommend her.

She loves to teach...gives so many quizes almost every week, some of them are in class, some are take home.her test is multiple choices, Tricky,but if you study you can make a good grade.She is very helpfull, always available for her student. Would definetely recomend taking her for Genetics. BUT be ready to study!!!
someone pls grade for spring 2007.

EXTREMELY thorough and super kind! Attendance is mandated and non-negotiable in ALL circumstances! She is very passionate.  The textbook is used rarely and her exams/quizzes over anything discussed in the lab- You are responsible for any and all material discussed in class/ lab- whether or not it's included on the study guide:(
Pretty easy teacher, a little strange sometimes, but not bad of a teacher. Gives alot of curves on tests.

This class was a fabulous intro! She is picky about time and attendance but that didn't bother me. Also, she is strict with labs but gave a guidelines sheet and if you go with that you are guarenteed a good grade! Be active in class/lab and it is an easy A. I heard her upper level courses are harder but still plan to take her again
Excellent teacher!!
No Comments
If I could describe her, I'd say passionate. The way she talks about what she teaches means she likes to teach. Very friendly and explains well. Definitely, take her!

Dr. V. is very nice and passionate about teaching/talking.  She does however, enjoy the sound of her voice and makes you know every detail inside-out.  DO NOT take her class unless you are prepared to spend every minute devoted to it only.  (+ strong org. chem., physics, & genetics background.)

Intelligent and sweet lady.  If you're a slacker, don't take her...she expects you to attend every class and earn your grade.  She is always there for her students if they need help with something.  Lots of opportunities for grades.

She was a helpful and easy teacher. If you follow directions, you can get an A because she will tell you exactly what you need to do. There is a LOT of busy work, but not many tests. If you don't like to come to lass, don't take her...she takes attendance for a grade every day.

Dr. Vogelien is a excellent teacher. However she acts a little crazy sometimes and honestly just needs some sleep. Her class was one the hardest classes I have ever taken, but take good notes and print the powerpoints and you will do good. (The FINAL IS AWESOME: A POWERPOINT PRESENTATION-89 with 5 h

she is very BORING! she talks on and on about stuff that doesnt even pertain to our subject. She picks her favorites out of the class and every thing they turn in has atleast and A on it, everyone else she takes off points for stupid stuff.
Dr. V, Is the most amzing teacher ever, she is very passionate about her subjects and loves to teach them. She will help any way possible.
Very helpful she will do anything for you if she can.  Awesome teacher! She is very easy to learn from and explains everything clearly.
